TEST_NAME: Redwood Buttons should be correctly placed
QUERY_CLOB:
with std as (select case when apb.display_position in ('Region Body', 'Body')
                         then case when apr.template not in ('Blank with Attributes','Collapsible','Cards Container')
                                   then 'BUTTON_RW_POSITION'
                                   end
                         end child_code,
                    apb.application_id,
                    apb.page_id,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    apb.last_updated_by,
                    apb.last_updated_on,
                    apb.display_position_code,
                    apb.button_is_hot,
                    apb.display_position,
                    apb.button_name,
                    apb.button_id component_id,
                    apb.button_template,
                    apb.button_position,
                    apr.template,
                    aap.build_option,
                    abo.build_option_status,
                    abo.status_on_export,
						        apb.workspace
            from apex_application_page_buttons apb 
            inner join apex_application_page_regions apr on apb.application_id = apr.application_id
                                                         and apb.page_id = apr.page_id
                                                         and apb.region_id = apr.region_id
            inner join apex_application_pages aap on apb.application_id = aap.application_id
                                                  and apb.page_id = aap.page_id
            inner join apex_applications aa on apb.application_id = aa.application_id
                                            and aa.theme_number = 1000
            left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on abo.application_id = aap.application_id 
                                                               and abo.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                               and coalesce(abo.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
						where apb.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
)
select case when std.child_code is not null
            then 'N'
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format ('Button `%0` (page %1, app %2) is in position `%3` but should be in a Redwood button position',
                            p0 => std.button_name,
                            p1 => std.page_id,
                            p2 => std.application_id,
                            p3 => std.display_position) 
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.child_code is not null
            then apex_string.format ('Button `%0` (page %1, app %2) is incorrectly placed',
                            p0 => std.button_name,
                            p1 => std.page_id,
                            p2 => std.application_id) 
            end issue_title,
	     std.child_code,
       std.button_is_hot,
       std.display_position,
       std.button_name,
       std.component_id,
			 null parent_component_id,
       std.button_template,
       std.button_position,
       std.template region_template,
       std.display_position_code,
			 std.workspace
from std
EXPLANATION: It is rarely correct to place Redwood buttons in the 'Region Body'/'Body' position.
FIX: Place the button in a Redwood, non-legacy position

TEST_NAME: Redwood Page Items should use Redwood Icons
QUERY_CLOB:
with std as (select case when ITEM_ICON_CSS_CLASSES like 'fa-%'
                         then 'N' 
                         else 'Y'
                         end pass_yn,
                    aapi.application_id, 
                    aapi.page_id,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    aapi.last_updated_by,
                    aapi.last_updated_on,
                    aapi.item_id component_id,
                    null parent_component_id,
                    aapi.item_icon_css_classes,
                    aapi.item_name,
						        aapi.workspace
               from apex_application_page_items aapi
               inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aapi.page_id and aap.application_id = aapi.application_id
               inner join apex_applications aa on aapi.application_id = aa.application_id
                                             and aa.theme_number = 1000
               left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
               left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aapi.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aapi.application_id
               where aapi.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
               and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
               and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude')
select std.pass_yn,
       std.application_id, 
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) uses a `Universal Theme` icon: `%3`. You must replace with a `Redwood` icon.',
                    p0 => std.item_name,
                    p1 => std.page_id,
                    p2 => std.application_id,
                    p3 => std.item_icon_css_classes
                    )
            end validation_failure_message,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('Page Item `%0` (page %1, app %2) has an invalid icon',
                    p0 => std.item_name,
                    p1 => std.page_id,
                    p2 => std.application_id
                    )
            end issue_title,
       std.component_id,
       std.parent_component_id,
       std.item_icon_css_classes,
       std.item_name,
			 std.workspace
from std
EXPLANATION: Redwood Page Items cannot use Universal Theme icons
FIX: Replace the icon with a Redwood Icon

TEST_NAME: List Entries should use the correct icons
QUERY_CLOB:
with std as (select case when aale.entry_image like 'fa%'
                         then 'N'
                         else 'Y'
                         end pass_yn,
                    aale.application_id, 
                    null page_id,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    aale.last_updated_by,
                    aale.last_updated_on,
                    aale.list_entry_id component_id,
                    aale.list_entry_parent_id parent_component_id,
                    aale.entry_image,
                    aale.entry_text,
						        aale.workspace
               from apex_application_list_entries aale
               inner join apex_applications aa on aale.application_id = aa.application_id
                                             and aa.theme_number = 1000
               left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aale.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aale.application_id
               where aale.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
               and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude')
select std.pass_yn,
       std.application_id, 
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       std.component_id,
       std.parent_component_id,
       std.entry_image,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('List entry `%0` (app %1) uses a Univeral Theme icon (`%2`). You must use a Redwood icon.',
                    p0 => std.entry_text,
                    p1 => std.application_id,
                    p2 => std.entry_image
                    )
            end  validation_failure_message,
       case when std.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format('List entry `%0` (app %1) uses an invalid icon',
                    p0 => std.entry_text,
                    p1 => std.application_id
                    )
            end  issue_title, 
       std.entry_text,
			 std.workspace
from std
EXPLANATION: List entries must not use a Universal theme icon in the `entry_image` field
FIX: Replace the icon with a Redwood icon

QUERY_CLOB:
with std as (select apb.application_id, 
                    apb.page_id, 
                    apb.button_id component_id, 
                    apb.button_name, 
                    bto.column_value template_option,
                    null created_by,
                    null created_on,
                    apb.last_updated_by,
                    apb.last_updated_on,
                    aap.build_option,
                    abo.build_option_status,
						 				abo.status_on_export,
						        abo.workspace
            from apex_application_page_buttons apb
            inner join table(apex_string.split(apb.button_template_options, ':')) bto 
                        on bto.column_value in ('rw-Button--sm', 'rw-Button--md', 'rw-Button--lg', 't-Button--tiny', 't-Button--small', 't-Button--large')
            inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.application_id = apb.application_id
                                                  and aap.page_id = apb.page_id
            left outer join apex_application_build_options abo on  abo.application_id = apb.application_id
                                                               and aap.build_option = abo.build_option_name
            where abo.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
						and coalesce(abo.status_on_export, 'NA') not in ('Exclude')
            )
select 'N'  pass_yn,
       std.application_id,
       std.page_id,
       std.created_by,
       std.created_on,
       std.last_updated_by,
       std.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` (app %1, page %2) should have a default size but currently has a size of `%3`', 
                          p0 => std.button_name,
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id,
                          p3 => std.template_option) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Button `%0` (app %1, page %2) should have a default size', 
                          p0 => std.button_name,
                          p1 => std.application_id,
                          p2 => std.page_id) issue_title,
       std.component_id,
       std.button_name,
       std.template_option,
			 null parent_component_id,
			 std.workspace
from std
EXPLANATION: Button size should be default - always.
FIX: Restore the button size to default

TEST_NAME: Pages have name, title and not a blank space
QUERY_CLOB:
with aap as (select case
                 when (trim(page_name) is null or lower(trim(page_name)) = ' '
                           or trim(page_title) is null or lower(trim(page_title)) = ' ') 
                      then 'N' 
                     else 'Y'
                   end pass_yn,
                   application_id, 
						       page_id,
						       page_name,page_title, page_mode,
                   created_by,created_on,last_updated_by,last_updated_on, 
						       build_option,
						       workspace
              from apex_application_pages
             where page_function != 'Global Page'
)
select aap.pass_yn,                          
       aap.application_id, 
       aap.page_id,
       aap.created_by,
       aap.created_on,
       aap.last_updated_by,
       aap.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing a name (`%0`) or title (`%3`)', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id,
        p3 => aap.page_title) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Page `%0` (app %1, page %2) is missing a name or title', 
        p0 => aap.page_name, 
        p1 => aap.application_id,
        p2 => aap.page_id) issue_title,
       aap.page_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aap.page_name,
       aap.page_mode,
       aap.page_title,
			 aap.workspace
from aap
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aap.application_id
where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
EXPLANATION:
WCAG 2.0/2.1 - 'Y'.3.1 Info and Relationships, 

 2.4.6 Headings and Labels

2.5.3 Label in Name

3.3.2 Labels or Instructions

4.1.2 Name, Role, Value

QUERY_CLOB:
select case when eba_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.heading) = 'N'
            then 'N'
            when eba_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.column_link_text) = 'N'
            then 'N'
            when aaprc.html_expression is not null 
            then eba_stds_parser.valid_html_yn(aaprc.html_expression)
            else 'Y'
            end pass_yn,                          
       aaprc.application_id, 
       aaprc.page_id,
       null created_by,
       null created_on,
       aaprc.last_updated_by,
       aaprc.last_updated_on,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML [html exporession :`%3`, heading:`%4`, column_link_text: `%5`', 
        p0 => aaprc.heading, 
        p1 => aaprc.application_id,
        p2 => aaprc.page_id,
        p3 => aaprc.html_expression,
        p4 => aaprc.heading,
        p5 => aaprc.column_link_text) validation_failure_message,
       apex_string.format('Classic Report Column `%0` (app %1, page %2) has malformed HTML', 
        p0 => aaprc.heading, 
        p1 => aaprc.application_id,
        p2 => aaprc.page_id) issue_title,
       aaprc.region_report_column_id component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
       aaprc.heading,
       aaprc.column_is_hidden,
       aaprc.column_alias,
       aaprc.html_expression,
       aaprc.workspace,
       aaprc.column_link_text
from apex_application_page_rpt_cols aaprc
inner join apex_application_pages aap on aap.page_id = aaprc.page_id and aap.application_id = aaprc.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on aabo1.build_option_name = aap.build_option
                                                     and aabo1.application_id = aap.application_id
left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on aabo2.build_option_name = aaprc.build_option
                                                     and aabo2.application_id = aaprc.application_id
where aaprc.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
EXPLANATION: Checking for matching html pairs
FIX: Fix the HTML - make sure all open tags are closed

QUERY_CLOB:
with tblfk as (select 
cons.table_name, 
cons.constraint_name,
cons.cname1 || nvl2(cons.cname2,','||cons.cname2,null) ||
nvl2(cons.cname3,','||cons.cname3,null) || nvl2(cons.cname4,','||cons.cname4,null) ||
nvl2(cons.cname5,','||cons.cname5,null) || nvl2(cons.cname6,','||cons.cname6,null) ||
nvl2(cons.cname7,','||cons.cname7,null) || nvl2(cons.cname8,','||cons.cname8,null) icolumns
from ( select b.table_name,
                b.constraint_name,
                max(decode( position, 1, column_name, null )) cname1,
                max(decode( position, 2, column_name, null )) cname2,
                max(decode( position, 3, column_name, null )) cname3,
                max(decode( position, 4, column_name, null )) cname4,
                max(decode( position, 5, column_name, null )) cname5,
                max(decode( position, 6, column_name, null )) cname6,
                max(decode( position, 7, column_name, null )) cname7,
                max(decode( position, 8, column_name, null )) cname8,
                count(*) col_cnt
            from (select substr(table_name,1,30) table_name,
                        substr(constraint_name,1,30) constraint_name,
                        substr(column_name,1,30) column_name,
                        position
                    from v_user_cons_columns ) a,
                v_user_constraints b
        where a.constraint_name = b.constraint_name
            and b.constraint_type = 'R'
        group by b.table_name, b.constraint_name
        ) cons
where cons.col_cnt > ALL
        ( select count(*)
            from v_user_ind_columns i
            where i.table_name = cons.table_name
            and i.column_name in (cname1, cname2, cname3, cname4,
                                    cname5, cname6, cname7, cname8 )
            and i.column_position <= cons.col_cnt
            group by i.index_name
        )
)
select 
'N' pass_yn,
'MISSING_FK :'||table_name unqid,
table_name, constraint_name, icolumns,
apex_string.format('Constraint %0 on column(s) %1 is missing an index', constraint_name, icolumns) code,
ao.object_id
from tblfk
inner join all_objects ao on ao.object_name = tblfk.table_name
                          and ao.object_type = 'TABLE'
EXPLANATION: Foreign keys must be indexed
FIX: Eg `create index eba_stdapp_idx1 on eba_stds_applications (type_id)`

QUERY_CLOB:
with proc_declrtns as (
    select line, name, object_name, signature, object_type
    from v_user_identifiers
    where type  in ('PROCEDURE','FUNCTION')
    -- and object_type = 'PACKAGE'
    and usage  = 'DECLARATION'
    and object_name not like '%_UT' --this requirement does not apply to utplsql packages
    and object_name not like 'XXX%')
select 
case when trim(us.text) like '--%'
     then 'Y'
     else 'N'
     end as pass_yn,
apex_string.format('%1 (line %2, %3) appears to be missing a comment', pd.object_name, pd.name, pd.line, us.type) code,
pd.object_name,
us.type object_type,
pd.line,
us.text,
to_char(pd.signature) unqid
from v_user_source us 
inner join proc_declrtns pd on  us.type = pd.object_type
                            and us.name = pd.object_name
                            and us.line = (pd.line - 1)
EXPLANATION: This procedure appears to be missing a comment or the comment is incorrectly formatted. All package procedures and functions require an explanatory comment

QUERY_CLOB:
with qry as (select
               case when lower(us.text) like '%nvl%'
                    then 'NVL'
                    when lower(us.text) like '%decode%'
                    then 'CASE'
                    when lower(us.text) like '% goto %'
                    then 'GOTO'
                    when us.text like '%(+)%'
                    then 'ANSI'
                    end as child_code,
               us.type object_type,
               us.name object_name, 
               us.text code, 
               us.line ,
               to_char(rank() over (partition by us.type, us.name, apex_string_util.to_slug(substr(us.text,1,255)) order by us.line)) as unqid
               from v_user_source us
               where us.name not like 'BIN$%'
               and us.name not like 'XXX%'
               and us.type in ('PACKAGE BODY','PACKAGE', 'PROCEDURE', 'FUNCTION')
               ),
     us as (
          select 'COMMIT' child_code,
                 u.object_type, 

                 u.object_name, 
                 'commit' code,
                 u.line,
                 u.signature unqid
          from v_user_statements u
          where u.type = 'COMMIT'
     ), 
     tst as (select 
                 q.child_code,
                 q.object_type, 
                 q.object_name, 
                 q.line, 
                 q.code, 
                 q.unqid
            from qry q
            where q.child_code is not null
            union all 
            select 
                 u.child_code,
                 u.object_type, 
                 u.object_name, 
                 u.line, 
                 u.code,
                 u.unqid
            from us u)
select 'N' pass_yn, 
      object_type, 
      object_name, 
      line, 
      apex_string.format('%0 (`%1`)',
                        p0 => case child_code
                              when 'ANSI' then 'ANSI SQL is discouraged'
                              when 'NVL' then 'Use `coalesce` instead of `nvl`'
                              when 'CASE' then 'Use `case` instead of `decode`'
                              when 'GOTO' then '`GOTO` is discouraged'
                              when 'COMMIT' then '`commits` are discouraged'
                              end,
                        p1 => substr(trim(code),1,25)
                    ) code, 
      unqid
from tst
EXPLANATION: Coding practices that are discouraged
FIX:
*   ANSI : Use ANSI SQL Syntax
*   CASE : Replace with CASE statement
*   COMMIT : Remove commit or at least add an explanatory comment
*   GOTO : Remove GOTO or at least add an explanatory comment
*   NVL : Replace nvl with coalesce

QUERY_CLOB:
with  declared_ids  
            as (select object_name  
                  , object_type  
                  , name
                  , type
                  , signature
                  , line
                  from v_user_identifiers
                  where usage = 'DECLARATION'
                  and type in ('VARIABLE', 'EXCEPTION','CONSTANT')
                  and implicit = 'NO'
                  and object_name not like 'XXX%'
                  and name not in ('C_LIMIT') -- hhh : the bulk collect limit value is not captured in the identifiers table
                  ),  
      used_ids
            as (select signature, line
                  from v_user_identifiers
                  where usage in ('REFERENCE','ASSIGNMENT')
               ),
      intersct as (
            select di.signature, count(*) it_count
            from declared_ids di 
            inner join used_ids ui on di.signature = ui.signature
                                   and di.line    != ui.line
            group by di.signature
      )
select 
case when it.signature is null
     then 'N'
		 else 'Y'
     end as pass_yn,
di.object_name, 
di.object_type, 
apex_string.format('Variable %0 should be dropped (it is unused)',di.name) code, 
di.type,
di.line,
to_char(di.signature) unqid
from declared_ids di
left join intersct it on  di.signature = it.signature
EXPLANATION: This identifier has been declared but is not referenced anywhere.
FIX: Remove the identifier or use it

QUERY_CLOB:
with userprocs as (select object_name, object_type, type, name proc_name, line start_line, LEAD(line, 1, 10000) OVER (partition by object_name ORDER BY line) end_line
                    from v_user_identifiers
                    where 1=1
                    and object_type = 'PACKAGE BODY'
                    and usage_context_id = 1
                    and type in ('FUNCTION', 'PROCEDURE')
                    and object_name not like 'XXX%'
                    and sys_context( 'userenv', 'current_schema' ) not in ('UT_CARS')
                    ),
     exec_imm as (select object_name, line ei_line, signature
                    from v_user_statements
                    where type = 'EXECUTE IMMEDIATE'
                    and object_type = 'PACKAGE BODY'
                 ),
     dass as (select name object_name, line da_line, text
                from v_user_source
                where lower(text) like '%dbms_assert%'
                and type = 'PACKAGE BODY')
select 
'N' pass_yn,
u.object_name, 
u.object_type, 
apex_string.format('%0 should use dbms_assert to safely use `execute immediate`',u.proc_name) code, 
ei.ei_line line, 
to_char(ei.signature) unqid
from userprocs u
inner join exec_imm ei on ei.object_name = u.object_name
                       and ei.ei_line between u.start_line and u.end_line
left join dass da on da.object_name = u.object_name
                  and da.da_line between u.start_line and u.end_line
where da.da_line is null
EXPLANATION: "Execute Immediate" should be validated with DBMS\_ASSERT : Input must be sanitized
FIX: Use dbms\_assert

QUERY_CLOB:
select
'N' pass_yn,
us.object_name, 
us.object_type,
us.line, 
apex_string.format('Consolidate instances of `%0`', substr(trim(us.text),1,30)) code,
to_char(rank() over (partition by us.object_type, us.object_name, sc.sql_id order by us.line)|| sc.sql_id) as unqid
from v_user_statements us
inner join (select sql_id
            from v_user_statements
            where sql_id is not null 
            and object_name not like '%_UT' --this requirement does not apply to utplsql packages
            having count(*) > 1
            group by sql_id ) sc on sc.sql_id = us.sql_id
where us.object_name not like '%_UT' --this requirement does not apply to utplsql packages
and us.object_name not like 'XXX%'
EXPLANATION: This statement appears more than once. Duplicate statements may cause inefficiency
FIX: Consider consolidating the statements into a single function or procedure

QUERY_CLOB:
with var_assgn as (select signature, max(line) last_line
                    from v_user_identifiers ui
                    where ui.type = 'VARIABLE'
                    and ui.usage = 'ASSIGNMENT'
                    group by signature),
     cur_ref_count
            as (select signature, count(*) refcount
                  from v_user_identifiers
                  where usage = 'REFERENCE'
                  and type = 'CONSTANT'
                  group by signature),
     ccode 
            as (select
                case when ui.type = 'CONSTANT' 
                        then case when ui.object_type = 'PACKAGE'
                                  then case when (ui.name not like 'GC_%') 
                                            then 'SPEC_CONSTANT'
                                            end
                                  when ui.object_type = 'PACKAGE BODY' 
                                    then case when ui.usage_context_id  = 1
                                              then case when ui.name not like 'GC_%'
                                                        then 'GLOBAL_CONSTANT'
                                                        else case when crc.refcount < 2
                                                                  then case when ui.name not in ('GC_SCOPE_PREFIX', 'GC_N', 'GC_Y')
                                                                            then 'LOCAL_GLOBAL_CONSTANT'
                                                                            end
                                                                  end 
                                                        end
                                              else case when  (ui.name not like 'C_%')
                                                        then 'LOCAL_CONSTANT'
                                                        end
                                              end
                                 end
                     when ui.type = 'VARIABLE'
                     then case when ui.object_type = 'PACKAGE'
                               then 'SPEC_VARIABLE'
                               when ui.object_type = 'PACKAGE BODY'
                               then case when ui.line = va.last_line
                                         then 'CONSTANT_VARIABLE'
                                         end
                               end
                     when ui.type in ('CURSOR','REFCURSOR') 
                     then case when ui.name not like 'CUR_%'
                               then 'CURSOR'
                               end 
                     when ui.type in ('INDEX TABLE', 'NESTED TABLE', 'ASSOCIATIVE ARRAY') 
                     then case when ui.name not like 'T_%'
                               then 'TABLE_TYPE'
                               end
                     when ui.type in ('FORMAL IN','FORMAL OUT', 'FORMAL IN OUT') 
                     then case when ui.name not like 'P_%'
                               then 'PROC_PARAM'
                               end
                     when ui.type = 'RECORD'
                     then case when ui.name not like 'R_%'
                               then 'RECORD_TYPE'
                               end 
                     when ui.type in ('BLOB DATATYPE','BOOLEAN DATATYPE','CHARACTER DATATYPE','CLOB DATATYPE','DATE DATATYPE','NUMBER DATATYPE', 'SUBTYPE','TIMESTAMP DATATYPE')
                     then case when ui.name not like 'TY_%'
                               then 'DATATYPE'
                               end
                     when ui.type = 'EXCEPTION'
                     then case when ui.name not like 'E_%'
                               then 'EXCEPTION'
                               end
                     end as child_code,
                null src_id, 
                ui.object_name, 
                ui.name code, 
                ui.object_type, 
                ui.line,
                to_char(ui.signature) unqid
                from v_user_identifiers ui
                left join var_assgn va on ui.signature = va.signature
                left join cur_ref_count crc on ui.signature = crc.signature
                where ui.usage = 'DECLARATION'
                and ui.implicit = 'NO'
                and ui.object_name not like 'XXX%')
select 
case when child_code is null
    then 'Y'
    else 'N'
    end pass_yn,
object_name,
apex_string.format('%0 %1',
                    p0 => code,
                    p1 => case child_code 
                          when 'CONSTANT_VARIABLE'
                          then 'must be a constant (it is currently a variable)'
                          when 'CURSOR'
                          then 'must begin with cur_ (it is a cursor)'
                          when 'DATATYPE'
                          then 'must begin with ty_ (it is a datatype)'
                          when 'EXCEPTION'
                          then 'must begin with e_ (it is an Exception)'
                          when 'GLOBAL_CONSTANT'
                          then 'must begin with gc_ (it is a package body global constant)'
                          when 'LOCAL_CONSTANT'
                          then 'must begin with c_ (it is a package body local constant) '
                          when 'LOCAL_GLOBAL_CONSTANT'
                          then 'should be a local constant (it is currently a global constant)'
                          when 'PROC_PARAM'
                          then 'must begin with p_ (it is a procedure parameter)'
                          when 'RECORD_TYPE'
                          then 'must begin with r_ (it is a Record type)'
                          when 'SPEC_CONSTANT'
                          then 'must begin with gc_ (it is a package spec constant)'
                          when 'SPEC_VARIABLE'
                          then 'should be moved to the package body'
                          when 'TABLE_TYPE'
                          then 'must being with t_ (it is a Table type)'
                          end
) code,
object_type,
line,
unqid
from ccode
where child_code is not null
EXPLANATION:
*   CONSTANT\_VARIABLE : This variable should be a constant
*   CURSOR : Cursor names must begin with cur\_
*   DATATYPE : Datatypes must begin with ty\_
*   EXCEPTION : Exceptions must begin with e\_
*   GLOBAL\_CONSTANT : Package body global constants must begin with gc\_
*   LOCAL\_CONSTANT : Package body local constants must begin with c\_
*   LOCAL\_GLOBAL\_CONSTANT : This global constant should be a local constant
*   PROC\_PARAM : Procedure parameters must begin with p\_
*   RECORD\_TYPE : Record types must begin with r\_
*   SPEC\_CONSTANT : Package spec constants must begin with gc\_
*   SPEC\_VARIABLE : Variables in the package spec are discouraged
*   TABLE\_TYPE : Table types must begin with t\_
FIX:
*   CONSTANT\_VARIABLE : Make the variable a constant
*   CURSOR : Fix the name
*   DATATYPE : Fix the name
*   EXCEPTION : Fix the name
*   GLOBAL\_CONSTANT : Fix the name
*   LOCAL\_CONSTANT : Fix the name
*   LOCAL\_GLOBAL\_CONSTANT : Make it a local constant
*   PROC\_PARAM : Fix the name
*   RECORD\_TYPE : Fix the name
*   SPEC\_CONSTANT : Fix the name
*   SPEC\_VARIABLE : Remove the variable from the package spec
*   TABLE\_TYPE : Fix the name

QUERY_CLOB:
select
'N' pass_yn,
ae.name object_name, 
ae.type object_type,
ae.line, 
ae.text code,
apex_string.format('%0:%1:%2:%3', ae.name, ae.line, ae.message_number, ae.sequence) unqid,
ae.message_number, 
ae.sequence,
ae.position,
ae.attribute
from v_user_errors ae
where ae.name not like 'XXX%'
and ae.message_number > 1919 -- will not compile
and (ae.message_number between 5000 and 5999 --severe according the to documentation
     or -- informational according to the documentation, but severe according to me
     ae.message_number in (6002, -- unreachable code
                           6009, -- procedure "string" OTHERS handler does not end in RAISE
                           6017 -- operation will raise an exception
                           )
    )
and ae.message_number not in (5018)
EXPLANATION: This script has some important violations caught by enabling PLSQL\_WARNINGS
FIX: Address the PLSQL warning and recompile

QUERY_CLOB:
select  'N' pass_yn,
        object_name,
        object_type,
        0 line,
        apex_string.format('%0 is invalid', object_name) code,
         'INVALID OBJECT : '||owner||'.'||object_name unqid
from v_user_objects
where status != 'VALID'
EXPLANATION: Object should be valid
FIX: Make the object valid or drop the object

QUERY_CLOB:
select 
	'N' pass_yn,
	341 src_id, 
	object_name view_name, 
	status,
	'INVALID_VIEW :'||object_name unqid
from v_user_objects
where status != 'VALID'
and object_type = 'VIEW'
EXPLANATION: Views must be valid
FIX: Fix the view and recompile

QUERY_CLOB:
select 
a110.pass_yn,
a110.application_id,
a110.page_id,
a110.page_name,
a110.redirect_url,
a110.button_name,  
a110.label, 
a110.region,
a110.created_by,
a110.created_on,
a110.last_updated_by, 
a110.last_updated_on,
case when a110.pass_yn = 'N'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^Button, `%1`/`%2`, has an invalid link: `%0` (region : `%3`)^',
     p0 => a110.redirect_url,
     p1 => a110.button_name,  
     p2 => a110.label, 
     p3 => a110.region
     )
     end as validation_failure_message,
case when a110.pass_yn = 'N'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^Button has an invalid link (page %0, app %1)^',
     p0 => a110.page_id,
     p1 => a110.application_id
     )
     end as issue_title,
a110.component_id,
a110.parent_component_id,
a110.workspace
from (
    select 
    eba_stds_parser.is_valid_url (p_origin_app_id => bl.application_id,
                                p_url           => bl.redirect_url
                                ) pass_yn,
    bl.application_id, 
    bl.redirect_url,
    bl.page_id,
    bl.page_name,
    bl.button_name,  
    bl.label, 
    bl.region,
    app.created_by,
    app.created_on,
    coalesce(bl.last_updated_by, app.last_updated_by) last_updated_by, 
    coalesce(bl.last_updated_on, app.last_updated_on) last_updated_on,
	  bl.button_id component_id,
	  null parent_component_id,
	  bl.workspace
    from apex_application_page_buttons bl
    inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = bl.page_id
                                          and app.application_id = bl.application_id
    inner join v_apex_applications aa1 on bl.application_id = aa1.application_id
                                       and aa1.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
	  left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo1 on  aabo1.build_option_name = app.build_option
                                                         and aabo1.application_id = app.application_id
    left outer join apex_application_build_options aabo2 on  aabo2.build_option_name = bl.build_option
                                                         and aabo2.application_id = bl.application_id
	  where bl.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
    and coalesce(aabo1.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
    and coalesce(aabo2.status_on_export,'NA') != 'Exclude'
) a110
EXPLANATION: The button URL is invalid
FIX: Fix the URL or eliminate the button

TEST_NAME: List entries should have valid build options
QUERY_CLOB:
select 
a80.pass_yn,
a80.application_id,
null page_id,
a80.child_code,
a80.created_on,
a80.created_by,
a80.last_updated_by, 
a80.last_updated_on,
case when a80.child_code = 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%3,%2) in list (%1, %0) has an invalid build option: %4 / %5^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.entry_target,
     p4 => a80.build_option,
     p5 => a80.build_option_status
     )
     when a80.child_code = 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%3,%2) in list (%1, %0) Excluded by build option for too long: %4 / %5^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.entry_target,
     p4 => a80.build_option,
     p5 => a80.build_option_status
     )
     end as validation_failure_message,
case when a80.child_code = 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^Invalid build option for list entry (%2) in list (%1) in app %3^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.application_id
     )
     when a80.child_code = 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
     then apex_string.format(p_message => 
     q'^List entry (%2) Excluded by Build Option for too long - in list (%1) in app %3^',
     p0 => a80.component_id,
     p1 => a80.list_name,
     p2 => a80.entry_text,
     p3 => a80.application_id
     )
     end as issue_title,
a80.component_id,
a80.parent_component_id,
a80.workspace
from (
     select
     case when bo.status_on_export = 'Exclude'
          then case when ale.last_updated_on is null 
                    then 'N'
                    when months_between (sysdate, ale.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get_preference ('AST_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                    then 'N'
                    else 'Y'
                    end
          when ale.build_option is null
          then 'Y'
          when validate_conversion(ale.build_option as number) = 1 
          then 'N'
          else 'Y'
          end pass_yn,
     ale.application_id,
     case when bo.status_on_export = 'Exclude'
          then case when ale.last_updated_on is null 
                    then 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
                    when months_between (sysdate, ale.last_updated_on) > svt_preferences.get_preference ('AST_CLEANUP_DELAY')
                    then 'LIST_ENTRY_BUILD_ABUSE'
                    end
          when ale.build_option is null
          then null
          when validate_conversion(ale.build_option as number) = 1 
          then 'VAL_BUILD_LIST_ENTRY'
          end child_code,
     ale.list_entry_id component_id,
     ale.list_entry_parent_id parent_component_id,
     ale.list_name,
     ale.entry_text,
     ale.entry_target,
     ale.build_option,
     aa.created_on,
     aa.created_by,
     ale.last_updated_by, 
     ale.last_updated_on,
     bo.build_option_status,
	   bo.status_on_export,
	   ale.workspace
     from apex_application_list_entries ale
     inner join v_apex_applications aa on  ale.application_id = aa.application_id
                                       and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
     left join apex_application_build_options bo on  ale.application_id = bo.application_id
                                                 and ale.build_option = bo.build_option_name
	   where ale.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
) a80
EXPLANATION:
\[List Build Entries are invalid\]

*   LIST\_ENTRY\_BUILD\_ABUSE : List Entry Excluded by Build Option for too long
*   VAL\_BUILD\_LIST\_ENTRY : The build option on this list entry is in an invalid state
FIX:
*   LIST\_ENTRY\_BUILD\_ABUSE : Remove the build or eliminate the page
*   VAL\_BUILD\_LIST\_ENTRY : Remove or replace the build option

QUERY_CLOB:
select a1.pass_yn, 
       a1.application_id,  
			 null child_code,
       a1.authorization_scheme,
			 null page_id,
       a1.created_by, 
       a1.created_on, 
       a1.last_updated_by, 
       a1.last_updated_on,
       case when a1.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a1.pass_yn = 'N'
            then issue_desc
            end as issue_title,
			 null component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 a1.workspace
from (
    select 
    case when aa.authorization_scheme is null
        then 'N'
        else 'Y'
        end as pass_yn,
    aa.application_id,
    aa.authorization_scheme,
    aa.created_by, 
    aa.created_on, 
    aa.last_updated_by, 
    aa.last_updated_on,
    apex_string.format( p_message => q'^Application %0 is missing an Authorization scheme^',
                        p0        => aa.application_id
    ) issue_desc,
	  aa.workspace
    from v_apex_applications aa
    where aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
) a1
EXPLANATION:
\[Applications have authorization schemes\]  
Applications should have application-level authorization schemes as a matter of best-practice
FIX: Specify an authorization scheme for your application. Application authorization schemes are defined for an application for the purpose of controlling access. Setting a required authorization scheme here at the application level will require all pages of the application to pass the defined authorization check.

TEST_NAME: HTML should be escaped in IG Columns
QUERY_CLOB:
select a20.pass_yn, 
       a20.application_id,
       a20.page_id,
       a20.region_id, 
       a20.region_name,
       a20.report_type,
       a20.column_alias,
       a20.report_label,
       a20.created_by, 
       a20.created_on, 
       a20.last_updated_by, 
       a20.last_updated_on,
       case when a20.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Region `%1` is escaping HTML for column `%3`/`%4` (Region id : %0, type : %2).^',
                                    p0 => a20.region_id, 
                                    p1 => a20.region_name,
                                    p2 => a20.report_type,
                                    p3 => a20.column_alias,
                                    p4 => a20.report_label
                                    )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a20.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => q'^Region `%1` (app %0, page %2) is escaping HTML for column `%4`^',
                                    p0 => a20.application_id, 
                                    p1 => a20.region_name,
                                    p2 => a20.page_id,
                                    p3 => a20.column_alias,
                                    p4 => a20.report_label
                                    )
            end as issue_title,
       a20.component_id,
       null parent_component_id,
			 a20.workspace
from (
     select 
     case when ic2.escape_on_http_output ='Yes'
          then 'Y'
          when ic2.escape_on_http_output is null
          then 'Y'
          else 'N'
          end as pass_yn, 
     ic2.application_id, 
     ic2.region_id, 
     ic2.page_id,
     ic2.region_name, 
     'IR' report_type,
     ic2.name column_alias,
     ic2.heading report_label,
     app.created_by, 
     app.created_on, 
     coalesce(ic2.last_updated_by, app.last_updated_by) last_updated_by, 
     coalesce(ic2.last_updated_on, app.last_updated_on) last_updated_on,
     ic2.column_id component_id,
	   ic2.workspace
     from apex_appl_page_ig_columns ic2
     inner join apex_application_pages app on  app.page_id = ic2.page_id
                                           and app.application_id = ic2.application_id
     inner join v_apex_applications aa on ic2.application_id = aa.application_id
                                       and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
	   where ic2.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
) a20
EXPLANATION: IG Report columns should escape HTML : Avoid turning the "Escape special characters" setting off on report columns
FIX: To prevent Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks, always set this attribute to **On**. If you need to render HTML tags stored in the page item or in the entries of a list of values, you can set this flag to **Off**. In such cases, you should take additional precautions to ensure any user input to such fields are properly escaped when entered and before saving.

TEST_NAME: SVT Application Pages should have Authorization Schemes
QUERY_CLOB:
with origin_auth as (select 
                         spu.destination_app_id, spu.destination_page_id
                         , listagg(distinct spu.element_authorization       ,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.element_authorization) origin_element_authorization
                         , listagg(distinct spu.parent_element_authorization,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.parent_element_authorization) origin_parent_element_authorization
                         , listagg(distinct spu.page_authorization          ,'/' on overflow truncate with count) within group (order by spu.page_authorization) origin_page_authorization
                         from v_mv_svt spu
                         where spu.destination_app_id is not null
                         and spu.destination_page_id is not null
                         and spu.url_type not in ('BC_URL') --breadcrumbs cause a lot of complexity in this context
                         group by spu.destination_app_id, spu.destination_page_id
                    ),
     a40 as (
          select 
          case when aap.page_requires_authentication = 'Yes'
               and aap.authorization_scheme is null
               then 'N'
			 				 when aap.authorization_scheme = 'APPLICATION SENTRY'
			 				 then 'N'
               else 'Y'
               end as pass_yn, 
          aap.application_id,
          aap.page_id, 
          aap.page_name, 
          aap.page_access_protection, 
          aap.page_mode,
          aap.page_requires_authentication,
          apex_string.format('%0:%1:%2:%3', oa.origin_element_authorization,oa.origin_parent_element_authorization, oa.origin_page_authorization, aa.authorization_scheme) origin_authorizations,
          aap.build_option,
          bo.build_option_status,
			    bo.status_on_export,
          oa.origin_element_authorization,
          oa.origin_parent_element_authorization origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
          oa.origin_page_authorization, 
          aa.authorization_scheme app_authorization_scheme,
          aap.created_by, 
          aap.created_on, 
          aap.last_updated_by, 
          aap.last_updated_on,
			    aap.workspace
          from apex_application_pages aap
          inner join apex_applications aa on aap.application_id = aa.application_id
                                          and aa.availability_status != 'Unavailable'
          left join apex_application_build_options bo on aap.application_id = bo.application_id
                                                  and aap.build_option = bo.build_option_name
          left join origin_auth oa on oa.destination_app_id = aap.application_id
                                   and oa.destination_page_id = aap.page_id
          where aap.workspace = svt_preferences.get_preference ('SVT_DEFAULT_WORKSPACE')
			    and aap.page_id != 0
          and (bo.status_on_export != 'Exclude' or bo.build_option_status is null)
     )
select a40.pass_yn, 
       a40.application_id,
       a40.page_id, 
       a40.page_name, 
       a40.page_access_protection, 
       a40.page_mode,
       a40.page_requires_authentication,
       a40.origin_authorizations,
       a40.build_option,
       a40.build_option_status,
       a40.origin_element_authorization,
       a40.origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
       a40.origin_page_authorization, 
       a40.app_authorization_scheme,
       a40.created_by, 
       a40.created_on, 
       a40.last_updated_by, 
       a40.last_updated_on,
       case when a40.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^Page %10 is missing an authorization scheme. 
            • Page Access Protection: %0
            • Page Mode: %1
            • Page Requires Authentication: %2
            • Origin Authorizations: %3 
            %4 
            %5^',
            p0 => a40.page_access_protection, 
            p1 => a40.page_mode,
            p2 => a40.page_requires_authentication,
            p3 => a40.origin_authorizations,
            p4 => case when a40.build_option is not null
                       then '• Build Option: '||a40.build_option
                       end,
            p5 => case when a40.build_option_status is not null
                       then '• Build status: '||a40.build_option_status
                       end,
            p6 => a40.origin_element_authorization,
            p7 => a40.origin_parent_elemnt_authztn, 
            p8 => a40.origin_page_authorization, 
            p9 => a40.app_authorization_scheme,
            p10 => a40.page_id
            )
            end as validation_failure_message,
       case when a40.pass_yn = 'N'
            then apex_string.format(p_message => 
            q'^Page %0 (app %1) is missing an authorization scheme^',
            p0 => a40.page_id, 
            p1 => a40.application_id
            )
            end as issue_title,
			 a40.page_id component_id,
			 null parent_component_id,
			 a40.workspace
from a40
where a40.application_id = 17000033
EXPLANATION: SVT Application pages should have authorization schemes for consistency and security
FIX:
Select an authorization scheme applied to the page. Authorization schemes are defined at the application-level and can be applied to many elements within the application.

An authorization scheme is evaluated either once for each application session (at session creation), or once for each page view. If the selected authorization scheme evaluates to **TRUE**, then the page displays and is subject to other defined conditions. If it evaluates to **FALSE**, then the page does not display and an error message displays.
